item.title: Not been emptied for 6 months, 6th July
item.description:
Should be emptied at least once every few weeks as it fills up quickly. Lucky if it does every 6 months. between Dahlia and Openshaw

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dahlia Road, Abbey Wood, London

item.title: Unlawfully designed box junction, 6th July
item.description:
The box junction expands over the whole junction when it should only cover the area where the is crossing traffic, not where traffic joins from the side road onto the main road. This causes confusion of who has priority. This box junction is also camera controlled

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nitrous oxide canisters dumped on pavement, 6th July
item.description:
Two boxes containing nitrous oxide canisters dumped on pavement. The same thing has happened several times in the past year

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hammelton Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedge of property affecting use of pavement, 6th July
item.description:
The tenants of this property are not controlling their boundary hedges & it’s so overgrown, it’s getting more & more difficult to walk on the pavement. This has been a problems for many months now. Wheelchairs & prams would need to go into the road to avoid it. There are also bins full /spilling over attracting rodents and wildlife. Not pleasant for local residents at all.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Chetwynd Avenue, Brunswick Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poo left all over pavement down alley leading from Strandfield close to Plumstead high street, 6th July
item.description:
Dog fouling all down alleyway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 154, Plumstead High Street, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Next door neighbour tree lifting our patio plus their bamboo coming through on our side, 6th July
item.description:
The next door neighbours tree lifts our patio paving. They have cut it back but it's still growing. They also have a huge bamboo that is coming through to our garden. The pic is 1 time it has come through but since then has also shot up on our side again. We are concerned also about it spreading underground & it is breaking the fence. The tree has started lifting the patio about a year ago & the bamboo a couple of years. We have messaged the owner a number of times over the years about the bamboo and he says he will remove it but never does.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park End, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
W3W: Sting-Lung-Order Damage to telegraph pole - exposed wires on footpath
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandy Ridge, Elmstead, London

item.title: Tree needs maintenance council property, 6th July
item.description:
Hi My council neighbour at 6 Shrubland rd used to prune this big tree. I don't think he's fit enough to continue as a result it's very big and the tree is growing branches in the lower part meaning that it is likely to damage the listed railings

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shrubland Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown Japanese Knotweed – Flat 201A Lordship Lane, 6th July
item.description:
I am writing to report an urgent issue regarding an overgrown and potentially hazardous infestation of Japanese knotweed in the rear garden at Flat 201A Lordship Lane. The garden has been abandoned for years, and the japanese knotweed is now visibly spreading into the neighbouring property at Flat 199A, raising serious concerns due to the invasive nature of this plant and the potential structural damage it can cause. We have attempted to contact the property owner without success, and the situation is escalating. Given the urgency of this issue, we kindly request that the Council investigates and takes steps to contact the owner of Flat 201A to ensure immediate remedial action is taken, as there is a clear risk the weed will expand to all surronding gardens, threatening numerous buildings.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Landcroft Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Contaminated water fountain?, 6th July
item.description:
Hi. The water fountain outside the pavillion is needing attention. It's growing algae in the spout and drain and might not be safe for people to refill their water bottles.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mandeville Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bin door will not open, 6th July
item.description:
A person has tied the bin door shut so we cant put rubbish in the bin. The man is sleeping inside where the bin is located with many beer bottles around him The bin is located at cheadle court nw8 8ud. This man is living there . Please can you get this man out the rubbish is piling up. Please can you look into this matter as soon as possible. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orchardson Street, St. John's Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 6th July
item.description:
Car has been reported previously. Car have now been parked there for over 2 weeks. Someone have thrown a brick through the back window. It is also left on a bend of the road which will cause an accident very soon. Traffic is building up as there is a narrow gap between cars. This is not fair on local residence with build up of traffic.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Wickham Lane, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement parking only on one side near junction, 6th July
item.description:
Today we were unable to get through with our Fire Appliance due to parking issues at the west end of Horsa road. There is pavement parking permitted along most of the street but not on the South side near the junction with Brook Street. This means cars are parking in the road making it too narrow. This section also needs pavement parking or a double yellow to prevent parking altogether as Emergency vehicles can not get through.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 124, Horsa Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree outside house, 6th July
item.description:
The tree outside my house number 4 fearon street is touching the bedroom window and a squirrel was trying to get in through the window. Its been happening for a few weeks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fearon Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown grass, discarded litter previous burn sites., 6th July
item.description:
This area is overgrown with lots of discarded litter. The path across the field is used by commuters and discarded litter and cigarettes result in frequent grass fires here. Proximity to the rail line can affest trains when on fire. This needs to be kept cut short.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clark Close, Slade Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car not moved for over 3 months, 6th July
item.description:
Not moved and taking up parking space which is at a premium
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wishart Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large clumps of grass and weeds have grown between paving slabs and house boundaries, 6th July
item.description:
Every time the grass verge is cut the cuttings are allowed to go everywhere, when before they were blown back onto the verge. Now they accummalate against house boundaries and take root between paving slabs. At the junction of Blenheim Road and Canterbury Ave large clumps of grass have formed creating trip hazards especially for the partially sighted, elderly and infirm.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Blenheim Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ground starting to sink, 6th July
item.description:
Started small dip but quickly has got lower and wider. Causes vehicle to bump down it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orchard Road, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
